#summary this shows you how to get started with AutonCanvas.
#labels Featured

= Sample Code =

the following code draws a circle:

{{{
<script type="text/javascript" src="auton-canvas.min.js"></script>
<script text="text/javascript">

window.onload = function() {
  // create a new canvas attached to the element named "canvas"
  var canvas = new auton.canvas.Canvas(900, 450, "canvas");

  // add a path object to our canvas. tell it to be a circle centered at (450, 450)
  var p = canvas.path(['R', 450, 450, 450]);

  // make the circle have a linear gradient fill, from green to transparent
  p.fill(['#0a0', 'transparent']);

  // update our canvas
  canvas.draw();
}

</script>
...
<div id="canvas"></div>
}}}
